intro: Phoradendron conzattii, commonly known as the Zanzibar milk tree, is a flowering plant native to the island of Zanzibar. It is a member of the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, pendulous inflorescences. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are often followed by fleshy, orange-red berries. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a waxy coating. Phoradendron conzattii is adapted to coastal environments and is known for its ability to thrive in saline conditions.
